questions.question_text: An organization would like to set up a more robust network access system. The network administrator suggests the organization move to a certificate-based authentication setup in which a client-side certificate is used while connecting. Which of the following EAP types should be used to meet these criteria?

discussion.content:
EAP-FAST: supports certificates (optional). 
PEAP & EAP-TTLS: require a certificate on the 802.1x server
EAP-TLS: requires certificates on both the 802.1x server and each of the clients.
EAP-TLS requires certificates on 802.1x servers as well as on each of its clients.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST likely the security impact of continuing to operate end-of-life systems?

choices.A: Higher total cost of ownership due to support costs
choices.B: Denial of service due to patch availability
choices.C: Lack of vendor support for decommissioning

discussion.content: It looks like it can be B or C, B seems like its missing something. I like C as a better answer.

comments.content: It's probably B. I take my test tomorrow let you know if I pass. 11:30 at home.
Did you pass? Were these questions helpful?

discussion.content: shouldn't the answer read as path unavailability or lack of patch availability?

questions.question_text: After downloading third-party software, a user begins receiving continuous pop-up messages stating the Windows antivirus is outdated. The user is unable to access any files or programs until the subscription is renewed with Bitcoin. Which of the following types of attacks is being executed?

discussion.content: just here to tell everyone "buy bitcoin"

The answer should be B. 
Ransomware types continue to evolve. In early versions, they sometimes just locked the user out of the system. However, this is rarely done anymore. Instead, attackers typically encrypt the user’s data to ensure that users can’t retrieve it. Ransomware that encrypts the user’s data is sometimes called crypto-malware.
"The user is unable to access any files or folders" This is telling us the files have been encrypted.
Gibson, Darril. CompTIA Security+ Get Certified Get Ahead: SY0-501 Study Guide (pp. 274-275). Kindle Edition.
i'm confused about the difference between ransomware and crypto malware. depending on the source the two terms seem to be interchanged

comments.content: Ransomware requires that someone pay the ransom, while crypto-malware can operate indefinitely on a system, benefiting the criminal without the victim having to do anything, and may never be noticed.
how does a scanner transfer files ?

discussion.content: D is the best, since disabled all external network access, not A

comments.content: this question is about transfering files not scanning. how would a scanning service transfer files ? Answer is clearly A

discussion.content:
Provided answer is definitely possible. Not sure, probably go with provided answer. 

The standalone Windows scanner can be used to manually collect a limited set of information from a Windows host. The scanner is designed to be used solely on isolated systems or networks. It is not equivalent to a Windows proxy or Outpost, because it collects only basic host, process, and package information that can be obtained by WMI queries, not additional data such as NIC registry information (for NIC discovery).

https://docs.bmc.com/docs/discovery/120/standalone-windows-scanning-tool-911456634.html
C and D makes no sense. Its either A/B
I think it should be A, upload to DMZ.

comments.content: I would not upload any media device in a DMZ, your asking for trouble.

choices.A: Upload the media in the DMZ
choices.B: Upload the data in a separate VLAN

questions.question_text: As a security measure, an organization has disabled all external media from accessing the network. Since some users may have data that needs to be transferred to the network, which of the following would BEST assist a security administrator with transferring the data while keeping the internal network secure?

discussion.content: While both LDAP and RADIUS are authentication protocols that enable users to access their organization’s resources, LDAP relies exclusively on unsecure credentials. The usability and security flaws of credentials have accelerated, and many organizations are unsatisfied with credentials as authentication protection for their network. As previously mentioned, RADIUS is not limited to only one authentication method; RADIUS can use MFA to provide greater protection than any one single method.

Are we supposed to understand those services/protocols to such a detailed level?

I guess the given answer is correct. I just found a document named RADIUS Attributes for Virtual LAN and Priority Support and I think this confirms that RADIUS attribute does support VLAN definition.

Source: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4675

I would stick with the provided answer. Looks correct. LDAP would provide no security thus most are moving over to LDAPS. Second RADIUS can be setup to be communicate with AD. 

https://community.spiceworks.com/topic/825318-dynamic-vlan-assignment-and-ad
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_usr_radatt/configuration/xe-16/sec-usr-radatt-xe-16-book/sec-rad-ov-ietf-attr.html

It appears Examtopics put this question here to make us study more. ANS C per Quizlet is right too. HOWEVER, I am reading this question would be BEST if we were to choose 2-answers; because A and C both are very useful together in combination with 802.1x. Because Radius attributes are also used in combination with LDAP. Both LDAP and Radius support 802.1x. Here is a useful link: 
https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/identity-security/privileged-access-manager/3-3/implementing/configuring-your-server/authenticate-users-logging-in-to-the-server/configure-ldap-and-radius-in-combination-to-authenticate-users.html

The answer should be C. LDAP Path

The answer should be A. Radius attribute

questions.question_text: A technician is implementing 802.1X with dynamic VLAN assignment based on a user Active Directory group membership. Which of the following configurations supports the VLAN definitions?
